source_documents.type: Alex Acosta / Non Prosecution Agreement documents
Perversion of Justice - detailed NPA analysis

non_prosecution_agreement.prosecutor: Alex Acosta - US Attorney Southern District of Florida
key_terms: Federal charges dropped in exchange for state guilty plea
Epstein served 13 months in county jail with work release
Named co-conspirators granted immunity (Kellen, Marcinkova, Groff, Ross)
Victims not notified as required by Crime Victims Rights Act
non_prosecution_agreement.aftermath: Acosta confirmed as Trump Labor Secretary 2017, resigned 2019 after Miami Herald investigation

key_prosecutors.name: Alex Acosta
key_prosecutors.role: US Attorney who approved NPA. Later Trump Labor Secretary 2017-2019.

key_prosecutors.name: Marie Villafaña
key_prosecutors.role: Line prosecutor who worked on Epstein case, expressed frustration with deal

key_prosecutors.name: Ann Marie Villafaña
key_prosecutors.role: Assistant US Attorney who investigated case

crime_victims_rights_act_lawsuit.filed_by: Paul Cassell on behalf of victims
crime_victims_rights_act_lawsuit.ruling: 2019 - Judge Kenneth Marra ruled government violated CVRA by not notifying victims
crime_victims_rights_act_lawsuit.significance: First successful CVRA challenge to federal plea deal

new_entities_discovered.name: Alex Acosta
new_entities_discovered.role: US Attorney who approved NPA 2008. Trump Labor Secretary 2017-2019. Resigned after Epstein re-arrest.

new_entities_discovered.name: Marie Villafaña
new_entities_discovered.role: Federal prosecutor on Epstein case. Expressed frustration with plea deal in emails.

new_entities_discovered.name: Kenneth Marra
new_entities_discovered.role: Federal judge who ruled government violated Crime Victims Rights Act in 2019.

new_entities_discovered.name: Roy Black
new_entities_discovered.role: Miami defense attorney, part of Epstein 'dream team' legal defense.

new_entities_discovered.name: Gerald Lefcourt
new_entities_discovered.role: Defense attorney, part of Epstein legal team.
